member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryOptions
member.summary: Provides programmatic configuration for the antiforgery token system.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryOptions.DefaultCookiePrefix
member.summary: The default cookie prefix, which is ".AspNetCore.Antiforgery.".

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryOptions.Cookie
member.summary: Determines the settings used to create the antiforgery cookies.

remarks.para: If an explicit is not provided, the system will automatically generate a unique name that begins with .

defaults to . defaults to true. defaults to true. The cookie used by the antiforgery system is part of a security system that is necessary when using cookie-based authentication. It should be considered required for the application to function. defaults to .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryOptions.FormFieldName
member.summary: Specifies the name of the antiforgery token field that is used by the antiforgery system.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryOptions.HeaderName
member.summary: Specifies the name of the header value that is used by the antiforgery system. If null then antiforgery validation will only consider form data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryOptions.SuppressXFrameOptionsHeader
member.summary: Specifies whether to suppress the generation of X-Frame-Options header which is used to prevent ClickJacking. By default, the X-Frame-Options header is generated with the value SAMEORIGIN. If this setting is 'true', the X-Frame-Options header will not be generated for the response.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryTokenSet
member.summary: The antiforgery token pair (cookie and request token) for a request.

member.summary: Creates the antiforgery token pair (cookie and request token) for a request.
member.param: The token that is supplied in the request.
The token that is supplied in the request cookie.
The name of the form field used for the request token.
The name of the header used for the request token.

member.summary: Gets the name of the header used for the request token.

member.summary: Gets the cookie token.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.IAntiforgery
member.summary: Provides access to the antiforgery system, which provides protection against Cross-site Request Forgery (XSRF, also called CSRF) attacks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.IAntiforgery.GetAndStoreTokens(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Generates an for this request and stores the cookie token in the response. This operation also sets the "Cache-control" and "Pragma" headers to "no-cache" and the "X-Frame-Options" header to "SAMEORIGIN".
member.param: The associated with the current request.
member.returns: An with tokens for the response.
member.remarks: This method has a side effect: A response cookie is set if there is no valid cookie associated with the request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.IAntiforgery.GetTokens(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Generates an for this request.
member.param: The associated with the current request.
member.remarks: Unlike , this method has no side effect. The caller is responsible for setting the response cookie and injecting the returned form token as appropriate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.IAntiforgery.IsRequestValidAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Asynchronously returns a value indicating whether the request passes antiforgery validation. If the request uses a safe HTTP method (GET, HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE), the antiforgery token is not validated.
member.param: The associated with the current request.
member.returns: A that, when completed, returns true if the request uses a safe HTTP method or contains a valid antiforgery token, otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.IAntiforgery.ValidateRequestAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Validates an antiforgery token that was supplied as part of the request.
member.param: The associated with the current request.
member.returns: A that completes when validation has completed.
member.exception: Thrown when the request does not include a valid antiforgery token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.IAntiforgery.SetCookieTokenAndHeader(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Generates and stores an antiforgery cookie token if one is not available or not valid.
member.param: The associated with the current request.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.IAntiforgeryAdditionalDataProvider
member.summary: Allows providing or validating additional custom data for antiforgery tokens. For example, the developer could use this to supply a nonce when the token is generated, then validate it when the token is validated.
member.remarks: The antiforgery system already embeds the client's username within the generated tokens. This interface provides and consumes supplemental data. If an incoming antiforgery token contains supplemental data but no additional data provider is configured, the supplemental data will not be validated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.IAntiforgeryAdditionalDataProvider.GetAdditionalData(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Provides additional data to be stored for the antiforgery tokens generated during this request.
member.param: Information about the current request.
member.returns: Supplemental data to embed within the antiforgery token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery.IAntiforgeryAdditionalDataProvider.ValidateAdditionalData(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext,System.String)
member.summary: Validates additional data that was embedded inside an incoming antiforgery token.
member.param: Information about the current request.
Supplemental data that was embedded within the token.
member.returns: True if the data is valid; false if the data is invalid.
